title: Prognosis Tracking Schema
description:
Create Comprehensive Prognosis Tracking Schema

Design and implement a database schema to track patient prognosis information, including expected length of hospital stay, disease progression metrics, and relevant clinical indicators.

Requirements:
- Define data model for prognosis records with temporal tracking capabilities
- Include expected length of stay field with date range (admission, expected discharge)
- Capture disease progression status (improving, stable, deteriorating, critical)
- Store clinical indicators relevant to prognosis (vital signs trends, lab values, functional status scores)
- Support versioning/history to track how prognosis changes over time
- Link prognosis data to patient records and specific diagnoses
- Include metadata fields (created_by, updated_by, timestamp, confidence_level)
- Define appropriate data types, constraints, and validation rules
- Consider relationships with existing patient, diagnosis, and treatment tables
- Ensure schema supports querying for prognosis trends and outcome analysis
- Document the schema structure with field descriptions and usage guidelines

Edge Cases to Consider:
- Handling prognosis updates when unexpected complications arise
- Managing multiple concurrent prognoses for patients with comorbidities
- Storing uncertain or provisional prognoses with confidence intervals
- Archiving historical prognosis data while maintaining query performance
